reviewText: The ART Method really is a METHOD that's different from all the rest.  Sure, it has squats and lunges but how they are incorporated makes all the difference.  You will need 2-4 yoga blocks but you can substitute something else or not use them.  At first, I thought it was a pain to use the blocks in the way that Terri suggests.  Didn't seem necessary.  But once you do these workouts a few times, you realize there is a METHOD that incorporates balance, functional strength/fitness, and attention.  I always thought I had good form from years of proper weight training but now I REALLY get it!  Terri has the ability to TEACH so you get the most out of any of the exercises.  These are no "lightweight" workouts.  You'll work up a sweat, feel the challenge and be energized when it's over!  The changes in your body that everyone talks about are REAL.  My hubby noticed improvements in just a couple weeks of 4 times a week.  I can't wait to see how hot I look in 3 months.  Not bad for a 63 year old with a replaced hip, huh?
summary: It's Different From All the Rest!
Title: N/A

reviewText: You know how you watch some exercise dvds, like, the "Buns of Steel" or whatever, and people are doing leg lifts for hours on end, and you say to yourself. "You know, that's easy, I can do that, no sweat?" and then at the end of it you collapse, and your whole lower body is all tingly, and you are drenched in sweat and you go "What the heck was that?!" (But You can't wait to do it again?)That's what this work out is.I am the kind of girl who likes this kind of workout. It's kind of hard to articulate what it is - it's not barre (which is what my cup of tea generally lies), but it's not exactly your traditional strength workout too. (and it's not a fusion - so get that outof your head). Terri teaches you how to exercise properly, in my very humble opinion, something that a lot of instructors tend not to do.And she works. you. out.You first learn a technique study, and if you think (as I did), bah, I know how to squat, I know how to do Abs, I know how to do a lunge - then you need to do this technique study and then you will be humbled. I was humbled. It just fires everything up more, and you think when you are working out. Which is great. In fact the Technique Study is sort of like a third workout on this dvd. Because I am sweaty, my heart is pumping and I am spent by the time i'm done.And then you work out to one of two workouts with an Abs that makes your core sing.This is just the start of the Terri Walsh Library. There is this dvd, (and then there is a cardio add on you can find on iTunes which is amazing as well).So what do you do/get?Well you have an2 Upper Body workouts2 Lower BodyTechnique StudyAbdominal workYou needA ChairA Mat4 yoga blocks. (these can be optional, but I would invest in them, to really get the full benefit of the workouts).(and a little bit of space. at least enough that you can kick your leg out without smashing it into something).It takes a bit of balance and co-ordination, but you'll get better. the more you work, is the better you'll get. I'm still rehabbing at the moment so I don't do this dvd as much as I'd love to, but I do the technique study to always re-engage my active points.Try this dvd, if anything, your butt and core will thank you. :)
summary: My Favourite Find of 2012. Engage Your Wallet, to Engage Your Body.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have done part one and part two and I can't wait to do them again. This video was much more difficult than I anticipated it being but it was great. I loved how well thought out the sequence and moves were. There was never a wasted moment. The pace is a bit fast and there is a lot of balance challanges but that is what makes this unique from my other thirty or so exercise dvds. I love how I feel after I am finished with this, how each part of my body was targeted; I never feel as though something was left out or worked more than the other (especially when you do part 1 and then part 2 the following day). Major Kudos to Terri Walsh for equally targeting my hams, glutes and quads. Many videos are so quad intensive I get a dread factor when trying to fit them into my routine. The leg sequence starts with a move and has add ons which was a really nice change of pace because while my legs got that good burn Terri changed it up well before it became a "bad" burn (taking that dread factor away).  Meanwhile, the arms are light weight high rep but I never felt rep'd to death in this video.My only complaint would be the ab work in the chair... I prefer mat ab work so I do my own or do a 10 minute ab section in my pilates dvd. This is a MINOR complaint. A.R.T. METHOD is going in the front of my line up and staying there for a while. About me, I work out 5-6 days a week for an hour minimum. I lift weights at the gym, I run and I do at home videos such as Squeeze Stronger, No More trouble Zones, Turbo Fire or Cardio Interval Burn and now the A.R.T. Method.

reviewText: I am loving Terri's ART method. It really teaches how to do  exercises appropriately. Its funny I thought I knew how to do squats and lunges, but this really teaches you how to focus. The first week, I could hardly walk! I was so sore, I almost cried, but I knew that I was doing the workout right. Terri is very accessible , you can also join her online community when you purchase the DVD. Great workout!

reviewText: The A.R.T Method DVD by Terri Walsh is one of the most innovative and effective workout DVD's on the market today. This DVD includes two 2 workouts that are both right around an hour each. The DVD includes a Warm up, Technique Study, 2 upper body workouts, 1 core and 2 lower body workouts and a cool down. This workout is 128bpm which keeps your body in the fat burning zone the entire time! Upon completing this workout you can expect be quite sweaty (which is so important for beautiful glowing skin) and also feeling long, tight and lean. I won't lie; you are going to be sore the next day! Terri's unique exercise sequencing is going to hit your muscles in ways that you have probably never worked them before! She does a fantastic job of working the entire body without actually overworking anything. I love the fact that she gives both beginner, intermediate and advanced modifications of most of the exercises. This workout also really challenges your balance on some moves which I love! You can expect to be using this DVD for a good long time, because you can really grow with it. Over time as you get stronger and can do the more difficult modifications you can experience brand new challenges. The Technique study included in this DVD which you do at the beginning of each workout is something that Terri created to pick up the slack that most DVDs leave out: Education! The tech study teaches you to "connect" to your body and really learn how to move properly. You will learn about the 4 Active Resistance Points and how to find, engage and maintain them throughout the workouts. This is the very basis of what the A.R.T method is and what sets it apart. To do this workout you need a mat, chair, and light pair of dumbbells. Terri uses 4 yoga blocks in the video which I HIGHLY recommend you get, but you can still do this DVD without them, especially if you are a beginner. This DVD is an absolute must have. I know several people that are currently using it and we all can't stop raving about the results we have received. I personally lost 11.5 inches off my entire body in my first month of the A.R.T method.Here is a break down of the workouts:Workout 1DemoTechnique StudyUpper body 1:Gravity PlankGravity Mountain climberChair dipsSquat with alternating bicep/tricep extensionShin stand with front raiseTripod rear delt extensionLateral raiseAlternating diagonal hyper extensionAbdominal SequenceLower body 1Lunge hip rear extensionStatic lungeStatic lunge with hip extensionSide plank extensionLaunch side hip extensionCool DownWorkout 2Warm upTechnique studyUpper body 2Balance with shoulder pressRow and balanceRow and balance with step upCurl, press, holdTwist, press , extendDeltoid/tricep extensionShin stand with bicep curlAbdominal sequenceLower Body 2(using a chair)Quad ExtensionChair leg extensionCombo Quad ExtensionStanding knee to elbowBent knee with kick backChair circle back with extendCircle back with lungeChair tenduChair circle sweep backCool down

reviewText: This is a modern and challenging workout! Terri does a great job demonstrating the moves. She really put together some unique sequences. I felt it the next day for sure. If you are a fan of Tracy Anderson Method or Hamelin D'Abbel Method-you will also appreciate the modern, light weight, high-rep, body weight work in this workout! The warm-up is fluid, large range of mothion moves and you can really customize this workout. You can do one of two pre-set routines or pick one or two or three a la cart. Very nice. Thanks Terri for sharing your Method with the common people who workout at home from DVD's!
